page.title: 01General Review of Burnhervie
page.content:
General Review of Burnhervie area.
The twelve square kilometre block at grid reference 03720819 lies west of the market town of Inverurie and north of the smaller town of Kemnay. The main settlement in the block is the tiny village of Burnhervie. Most other inhabitants in the block live in isolated farm cottages. The River Don flows through the block towards Inverurie. Higher ground is given over to afforestation, mostly conifer. Agriculture is the main use of land at lower levels nearer the river. The block area is scantly populated by a mixture of farm tenants and labourers. Some residents commute to Inverurie and Aberdeen.
